title: China's DF-41 missile: Media claims it 'can level the whole New York City with a single strike'
text:
China's newly unveiled DF-41 ballistic missile 'can level the whole New York City with a single strike', the country's media has warned.

The nuclear-capable weapon, said to boast the longest range of any ballistic missiles in the world, was shown off by China for the first time earlier this month.

The chilling warning was issued after Beijing blasted American companies and organisations, including the NBA and Apple, for making comments or products in support of anti-government protests in Hong Kong.

It also came a day before China's President Xi warned that any attempts to divide the country would end in 'crushed bodies and shattered bones'.

Scroll down for video

China's DF-41, or Dongfeng-41, is said to boast the longest range of any ballistic missiles in the world. The weapon is pictured being unveiled in a military parade in Beijing on October 1

'One DF-41 could hit and destroy mega cities such as New York without a problem,' wrote Chinese military commentator Xi Yazhou who warned the United States not to take risks

DF-41, or Dongfeng-41, is said to be capable of ranging up to 9,300 miles - putting the entirety of America within its reach.

It is said to be able to carry up to 10 nuclear warheads which can be independently manoeuvred, meaning it can strike 10 targets simultaneously.

In order to evade defence systems, it also carries decoys and can hit the United States within 30 minutes of launch, limiting the amount of time defence systems have to respond.

DF-41 is said to be capable of hitting the United States within 30 minutes of launch from China

In a commentary published on Saturday, the analyst also showed an image demonstrating how four warheads carried by DF-41 could hit the US eastern coast, destroying the Big Apple

Chinese military analyst Xi Yazhou claimed that DF-41 would actually ensure the safety of the American people because it could prevent Washington from 'running risks' and disagreeing with Beijing.

'The stronger the deterrence is, the less likely imperialists would run risks,' the expert gushed in an op-ed published on Sina.

Although DF-41 has been hailed for its reported capability of carrying 10 nuclear warheads simultaneously, in order to strike the entirety of the United States it would need to be equipped with less warheads to reduce its weight, said the independent commentator.

China's President Xi has warned that any attempts to divide the country would end in 'crushed bodies and shattered bones'. The leader is pictured at the National Day parade on October 1

'Therefore, DF-41 should normally carry three to four W88 warheads with a yield of around 500 kilotons or one single warhead with a yield of one million ton,' he claimed.

He added: 'One DF-41 could hit and destroy mega cities such as New York without a problem.'

The author then showed an image demonstrating how four warheads could hit the US eastern coast, destroying the Big Apple.

The mighty weapon, which took 10 years to develop, is 'the pillar of Beijing's strategic nuclear power', said state broadcaster CCTV. It is pictured during its debut in Beijing on October 1

DF-41 made its public debut in Beijing on October 1 during a military parade in celebration of the 70th anniversary of the founding of Communist China.

The mighty weapon, which took 10 years to develop, is 'the pillar of Beijing's strategic nuclear power', said state broadcaster CCTV.

DF, the short form of Dongfeng, means 'east wind' in Chinese. It's the name given to a series of missiles used by China's People's Liberation Army.
description: 'One DF-41 could hit and destroy mega cities such as New York without a problem,' one Chinese military analyst has claimed. He issued the chilling warning to Washington on Saturday.
